H0.text: Meter is the most appropriate unit of measurement for expressing the distance between the Milky Way galaxy and other galaxies.

H1.text: Kilometer is the most appropriate unit of measurement to express the distance between the Milky Way galaxy and other galaxies.

H2.text: Light-year is the most appropriate unit of measurement to express the distance between the Milky Way galaxy and other galaxies.

H3.text: Astronomical unit is the most appropriate unit of measurement to express the distance between the Milky Way galaxy and other galaxies.

A5.text: The astronomical unit is too small to be convenient for interstellar distances, where the parsec and light-year are widely used.

A6.text: The light-year is often used in popular works, but is not an approved non-SI unit and is rarely used by professional astronomers.
